intro: Prunella grandiflora var. pinnatifida, commonly known as narrow-leaved heal-all, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. It is perennial, with a compact growth habit and is often found in temperate climates. Its common name reflects its historical use in traditional herbal medicine for its perceived healing properties.
